job_description: Who We AreAt Vale, we believe in innovation as a foundation for our development, to create the mining of the future and achieve our vision of being the biggest and best mining company in the world.Operating in Canada for over 100 years, we are a leading producer of iron-ore, copper, cobalt and precious metals and the world’s second largest nickel mining company. We aim to grow profitably but only as a safe, high-quality and sustainable mining company.Are you interested in joining our team of over 6,000 professionals in Canada?We employ a wide range of occupations from engineers, underground miners and supervisors in Thompson, Sudbury and Voisey’s Bay, to our R&D team from our world class Technology Centre in Mississauga.The Manitoba Operations, located in Thompson Manitoba was the world’s first fully-integrated nickel mine where ore is mined, concentrated, refined and shipped to market all from one location.  With three operating mines – Thompson Mine, T-3 Mine and Birchtree Mine - Manitoba Operations has a strong future in mining and milling, with a goal to grow as a safe, high quality, sustainable and long-term nickel producer.  Manitoba Operations also has a strong commitment to Zero Harm to its employees, the community and the environment.Our Manitoba Operations is currently seeking an:ELECTRICAL SUMMER STUDENT - CENTRAL ENGINEERING  (2015)Working within the Central Engineering team, the summer student will aid the department Engineers in providing technical support for plant operations and maintenance.
job_requirements: Accountabilities:Participate as a team member of single discipline as well as multi-discipline engineering projects (Civil, Mechanical, Electrical, and Instrumentation). Perform design and drafting work for projects.Provide field inspections for projects as assigned.Work with senior engineers to advance skill setEducation:The ideal candidate will be:Currently enrolled in an Electrical Engineering Degree Program at an accredited Canadian University.Preferences will be given to 3rd year students going into their 4th year of study.Knowledge and Skills:Strong computer skills requiredExperience working on project teamsExperience in Microstation, or AutoCAD drafting software an assetComments:Please be advised that only those applicants who are selected for interviews will be contacted Please note that this position is for the summer of 2015Vale is an equal opportunity employer.Open To All Majors:No
